body:
Hi,


Basic question as a beginner in Radiance: I want to run ModelToRad.rb
using Windows CMD command line:


ruby ModelToRad.rb test_01.osm


But I get the following error:


C:/Ruby193/lib/ruby/site_ruby/1.9.1/rubygems/custom_require.rb:36:in `require':
cannot load such file -- openstudio (LoadError)
        from C:/Ruby193/lib/ruby/site_ruby/1.9.1/rubygems/custom_require.rb:36:in
`require'
        from ModelToRad.rb:45:in `<main>'


Should I put the path to Openstudio.exe in the require command?  What
about the other "require" lines:


require 'openstudio'
require 'openstudio/energyplus/find_energyplus'
require 'fileutils'


require 'optparse'
require 'ostruct'


Best,


M.Sc. Farhang Tahmasebi
Department of Building Physics and Building Ecology
Vienna University of Technology
___
